children.value: This section is under construction. Join the
channel to learn more about translation opportunities.

Welcome to the MakerDAO Translation Initiative. Our goal is to bring Maker’s educational content worldwide by providing material for people in their native languages. This document summarizes the guidelines for translators.
The role of a translator is to create the initial translation from the original English documents.
All languages have their nuances, so there is some flexibility when changing the text to be more readable in a new language. Communicate with the rest of the team early and often in the
channel. Don’t be afraid to ask others for advice.
Bring the subject up in the
Ensure terms are translated uniformly across all documents.
Writing should be plain, simple, and accessible. Maintain contact with other translators as they work on documents. Be sure to agree on translated terms and other conventions.
Ensure that translated documents retain original formatting.
The blockchain space is relatively new. Various languages are slowly developing terms to match the English vocabulary. Reach out to other community members in the
room to consult on the best way to translate various terminology.
All documents are formatted in Markdown. They contain headers, lists, links, tables, etc. Information about Markdown can be found on
make working with Markdown more convenient.
Do not translate them, the editors will handle any necessary changes to links.
of the specific things you would like editors to keep in mind.

Feel free to use any software that helps find translation errors and improve writing. We encourage using tools that assist workflow, but copying directly from a program will disqualify you from receiving a bounty and from future assignments. Please use them as an aide and not a substitute for your work.
channel in our chat. We encourage reaching out to translators and editors for guidance.
Ask about open translation opportunities in the
Get assigned a task by the project coordinator.
Go to the GitHub documents list and select the assigned document.
Click "Raw", select all, and copy to clipboard
Go to the markdown editor of your choice
Forward the completed document to the project coordinator, keeping its original name, eg.
Soon after, the editor will read over your work and may reach out to you for clarifications and opinions.
Once the editing process is finished, the project coordinator will publish the work and you will get information on how to collect the bounty.
for the Translation Initiative. Come talk to us.
We're always looking for ways to improve this program. Please don’t hesitate to share your feedback
